page.title: 09Cider Farm, Kingsbury.
page.content: First we saw the cider apple orchards. Around October the apples are picked, washed and put into a wooden pit.Then they are carried on steps up a narrow moving belt to a crusher which pulps them.The pulp comes down a tube onto a cloth on a trolley.When the pulp is about 15 cm deep it is wrapped in the cloth and a square board is placed over it.This procedure is repeated until there are 20 boards with 15 cm depth of pulp in cloth between each pair.The trolly is then pushed under a press.The apples are pressed till all the apple juice has been pumped through a pipe to a vat.Sugar and yeast are added.The yeast turns the sugar into alcohol. Cider is left in a vat for about 6 months and then it is pumped into barrels to be sold.
